source:
<class name="CompoundUnit" extends="DerivedUnit" startLine="14">
*
This class represents the multi-radix units (such as "hour:min:sec"). * Instances of this class are created using the {@link Unit#compoundUnit.compound} method. *
Examples of compound units:[code] * Unit HOUR_MINUTE_SECOND = HOUR.compound(MINUTE).compound(SECOND); * Unit DEGREE_MINUTE_ANGLE = DEGREE_ANGLE.compound(MINUTE_ANGLE); * [/code] Jean-Marie Dautelle 3.1, April 22, 2006
* Holds the higher unit.
<declaration type="Unit" name="_high" />
* Holds the lower unit.
<declaration type="Unit" name="_low" />
* Creates a compound unit from the specified units. high the high unit. low the lower unit(s) IllegalArgumentException if both units do not the same system * unit.
* Returns the lower unit of this compound unit. the lower unit.
<method type="Unit" name="getLower" startLine="61" endLine="63" />
* Returns the higher unit of this compound unit. the higher unit.
<method type="Unit" name="getHigher" startLine="70" endLine="72" />
* Indicates if this compound unit is considered equals to the specified * object (both are compound units with same composing units in the * same order). that the object to compare for equality. true if this and that * are considered equals; falseotherwise.
<declaration type="CompoundUnit
